title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 206.2 - Terms and parts of court
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 206.2 - Terms and parts of court

State Regulations
(a) Terms of court. A term of court is a
four-week session of court, and there shall be 13 terms of court in a year, unless otherwise provided in the annual schedule of terms established by the

Chief Administrator of the Courts, which also shall specify the dates of such
terms. (b) Parts of
court. (1)
A part of court is a
designated unit of the court in which specified business of the court is to be
conducted by a judge or quasi-judicial officer. (2)

There shall be such parts of the

Court of Claims as may be authorized from time to time by the Chief

Administrator of the Courts. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22
ยง
206.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
